msItem.author: 'John Mandeville'
msItem.title: Travels
msItem.rubric: Here bigynneth þe book of Johan Maundevyle þe knyght which techeþ þe weyes to Jerusalem to Inde to þe grete Cane and to the Soudan & to Preter Johanes londe and of many oþere meruayles and ek diuerse contrees and naciouns as þe booke telleþ.
msItem.incipit: For als moche as þe londe ouer þe see, þat is to saye þe holy londe, that men calle the lond of byh amonge all oþre londes it is þe most worþy and yne of alle oþre londes, and is blessed and sacred of þe preciouse blood of our lorde
msItem.explicit: And I praye to god of whom all grace comeþ þat he wolde fulfille with his grace all þe reders and herers þat are cristene men and saue hem body and sould and bringe hem to þe ioye þat euere schal laste, he þat is in trinite, fader and sone and holy goste, þat lyueþ and regneth god withouten ende þider vs alle sende. Amen.
msItem.note: No chapter numbers or headings; textual divisions, signalled by decorated initials, are on fols. 9v, 27v, 30v, 33v, 34r, 49v, and 54r. Latin text usually rubricated.

listBibl.bibl: The Defective Version of Mandeville's Travels, ed. M. C. Seymour, EETS O.S. 319 (2002), who classifies this manuscript in subgroup 4 (MS. 4A; pp. xxiii-iv); the manuscript is briefly described on pp. 204-5.

msItem.textLang: Middle English (language of SE Midlands according to ed. cit., p. 204)

msItem.title: Spiritus Guidonis (tr., 'The Spirit of Guy')
msItem.incipit: For als muche as seint Augstyn seith to Petre in þe booke of bileue þat it is a myracle what heiȝe þinge oþer vncustomable þing so comeþ ouer mannes faculte to þe strengþing of oure faithe, for why alle þinges þat ben writen ben writen to oure techynge
msItem.explicit: And all þis þinges saide þe spirit and helde him stille and was no more herde. Alle þese þinges weren yprouede bifore pope Johan twenty and tuo and in þe day after next folwynge þe pope sente þider and fonde nought þe forsayde spirit. Wherfore men trowen wel þat he is now in heuene, to þe whiche heuene brige ȝow goddes sone þat lyueth and regneþ with þe fader and holy goste wiþouten ende. Amen.
msItem.rubric: Explicit Spiritus Guidonis de Ciuitate Alexti [in the ink of the text]
msItem.note: The story of an apparition and its disputation with a Dominician prior about purgatory in 1333.
Presumably two leaves lost after fol. 75, now marked by the blank leaves 76 and 77.
Fol. 87v ruled, blank except for later pen-trials.

Other manuscripts: MS. Eng. poet. a. 1, fols. 363vb–366vb [indexed IMEP 12]; Cambridge, Gonville and Caius 175/96, p. 156 (fragment) [indexed IMEP 17]; London, British Library, Add. MS 22283, fols. 168r-170v; Oxford, Queen's College, MS. 383, fols. 135r-164v [indexed IMEP 8].
